channel.title: Why havent
channel.description:
why havent jagex forced this and moparscape to close down like kaitnes?? or the law?
we do private servers, bots, scar, and other runescape cheating. and warez and such stuff
and why dont the law close down rapidshare? they host most warez, like megaupload and many more?
how come so many unlegal sites still run?

item.title: Why havent
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

Mr.Chris:

I find it funny that people think that you can invent laws through a TOS agreement.

To a certain extent you can (for example a EULA, or the LGPL). However, you can’t use it to hide illegal activies in a “what you don’t know can’t hurt you!” type fashion, like most warez sites seem to think you can. (They even invented a law for it, a lot of them quote a non-existant act apparently passed in 1995).

EDIT: http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Internet_Privacy_Act - That’s where this type of thinking stems from.

Read full topic

item.title: Why havent
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

[quote=“nicodk, post:1, topic:69844”]we do private servers, bots, scar, and other runescape cheating.
and warez and such stuff[/quote]

SCAR isn’t illegal, we don’t have bots, the only thing about private server’s that’s illegal is the modified client, warez aren’t hosted on our server.

@jme wrote:

nicodk:

well then i dont nuderstand how kaitnes was shut down. i read that jagex forced him to shut down. i cant find the source where i read it but he was forced to shut down.

They didn’t. Like Mopman said it was his own free will. He had a daughter, and probably just decided it was time to throw in the towel. jagex’s threats were getting much more serious, and kaitnieks even said that he knew he would win the case.

item.title: Why havent
item.dc:creator: @jme jme
item.description:
@jme wrote:

Mopman:

LOL at people thinking that saying “Jagex you can’t come in here!” actually works.

I know, however most are still young or haven’t really looked up any of these laws. I used to think that way, until I read up as much information as I could about copyright and stuff.

Read full topic

item.title: Why havent
item.dc:creator: @BobDole81 BobDole81
item.description:
@BobDole81 wrote:

And you think they listen to that? I just suspect that disclaimer prevents them from admitting that they’ve visited the site.

But we haven’t been taken down because we’re really not doing anything illegal. RS Cheating isn’t illegal…its against runescape’s terms of service, but it has no legal repercussions. Private servers aren’t either - they are just emulators of the real server - no copyright infringement. What would illegal, however, is the distribution of reverse-engineered, copyrighted code (which is really what moparscape is). However, we don’t host that stuff…so we’re pretty much ok (I hope :))

Read full topic

item.title: Why havent
item.dc:creator: @davidude36 Brolapse
item.description:
@davidude36 wrote:

Well they can indeed browse the website, but they cannot take action against these sites because they would be breaking the agreement they made by typing “yes”. Therefore we could sue them back.

Read full topic

item.title: Why havent
item.dc:creator: @devull devull
item.description:
@devull wrote:

because on the TOS it says:

By typing ‘yes’ you agree to everything stated below:

You are not an employee of Jagex LTD, runescape, or adlex solicitors, and are not a family member or acquaintance of the aforementioned.

so they can not browse the site[br][size=1]Posted on: March 22, 2007, 08:44:32 AM[/size][hr]and kaitnes got closed for advertising on runescape.com ( from what i have heard )

Read full topic

item.title: Why havent

item.description:

Because they don’t consider us a threat.

“Jagex employees can’t enter the site”? Why?

item.title: Why havent
item.dc:creator: @YourDistracted YourDistracted
item.description:
@YourDistracted wrote:

Because of terms and conditions of service and use. Rapidshare and other filehosts aren’t responsible for content and TOS saves everyone from getting sued etc. Everything on here is ok i guess. And jagex employees cant enter the site. Moparscape is changed just enough to not get sued (me thinks)
